item.title: Funding awarded to support the growth of CURIOSS
item.description: The Alfred P. Sloan Foundation has awarded funding to Clare Dillon and Richard Littauer to develop and expand the work of CURIOSS, the community for university and research institution OSPOs, over the next three years.

item.title: New CURIOSS members
item.description: CURIOSS is delighted to welcome six new University Open Source Program Offices (OSPOs) to the CURIOSS network.

item.title: Funding awarded for CURIOSS Network
item.description: The Alfred P. Sloan Foundation has awarded a one-year grant to coordinate a set of community-centered activities focused on university-based and research institution Open Source Program Offices (OSPOs).

item.title: Community Code of Conduct
item.description: Our Pledge We as members, contributors, and leaders pledge to make participation in our community a harassment-free experience for everyone, regardless of age, body size, visible or invisible disability, ethnicity, sex characteristics, gender identity and expression, level of experience, education, socio-economic status, nationality, personal appearance, race, religion, or sexual identity and orientation.

item.title: Contact CURIOSS
item.description: CURIOSS is a Community for University and Research Institution OSPOs. If you want to find out more about the CURIOSS community, please drop us an email @ info@curioss.
